availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Tinsley (Knox County, Kentucky soldier)

body.p: Knox County, Kentucky soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Alfred Tinsley and Mary Craig Tinsley. Married to Elizabeth Hanna Tinsley. Resident of Knox County, Kentucky in 1850. Resident of Knox County in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as first sergeant from September 22, 1861 to January 25, 1863. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from January 25, 1863 to August 4, 1863. Served in the 49th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant and adjutant from December 23, 1863 to December 26, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, p. 335B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, Barboursville, p. 26.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #981,992, Certificate #739,530.
